subject: fix tox python3 overrides
messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-09-29 23:50:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-01-09 08:37:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:50:31.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I2b8f1127f4203223bdb879171d6a6978b652a27b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I2b8f1127f4203223bdb879171d6a6978b652a27b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers and corresponding amulet update

The amulet tests now explicitly specify the pymysql driver for the
mysql sqlalchemy dialect. The sqlalchemy package has switched back
to using mysqldb as the default driver for the mysql dialect in
Ubuntu Disco (Stein) and charm-helpers has been updated
accordingly to maintain the same behavior.

Change-Id: I0ac216eeb01727797417ab3a37e40c1e66b8264f

[{'created': '2019-01-08 13:55:23.000000000', 'message': 'Only implement policy.json if an override is configured

With I610115dc1974b2182ce673bb086a1da15b022de3 merged there
is no longer a default policy.json file in the venv, so we
need to change how we implement the file, and should only do
so if there is a config override configured for it.

Change-Id: Ifd0e57e14d5691daf4d715a46bdea2f1d90050d5
'}]
commit_message:
Only implement policy.json if an override is configured

With I610115dc1974b2182ce673bb086a1da15b022de3 merged there
is no longer a default policy.json file in the venv, so we
need to change how we implement the file, and should only do
so if there is a config override configured for it.

Change-Id: Ifd0e57e14d5691daf4d715a46bdea2f1d90050d5

using the "-f graphml" in cli command for topology and rca

commit_message:
Resync charms.ceph and charmhelpers

Resync the latest charms.ceph to avoid direct installation
of Python 2 modules which are not available in the latest
Ceph packaging which no longer provides Python 2 support.

This commit also updates two action which still used Python
to use Python 3 (inline with the rest of the charm).

Change-Id: I8fc2a1aa17e48ef5dac9b9974c33b9620fcb7c70

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-25 06:55:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add `default` to network segment range resource

This patch is a follow-up to [1] to propose adding a new `read-only`
attribute `default` to the network segment range resource. It tracks
whether this is a range that is managed/loaded from the host ML2 config
file [2].

The attribute is proposed based on the following considerations:
1. We prefer the underlying network segment ranges to be exposed so that
   an admin can base on the info to make per-tenant range assignment;
2. We want the backward compatibility to be maintained, i.e. no work
   flow change with and without the extension is loaded;
3. We need to handle the range DB refresh/config repopulation when a
   Neutron server starts/restarts.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/624709
[2] /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini

Co-Authored-By: Matt Peters <matt.peters@windriver.com>

Partially-implements: blueprint network-segment-range-management
Change-Id: I8cc0ed77603a5d430c6d7b2b503c7b5a80ed0051

commit_message:
Add `default` to network segment range resource

This patch is a follow-up to [1] to propose adding a new `read-only`
attribute `default` to the network segment range resource. It tracks
whether this is a range that is managed/loaded from the host ML2 config
file [2].

The attribute is proposed based on the following considerations:
1. We prefer the underlying network segment ranges to be exposed so that
   an admin can base on the info to make per-tenant range assignment;
2. We want the backward compatibility to be maintained, i.e. no work
   flow change with and without the extension is loaded;
3. We need to handle the range DB refresh/config repopulation when a
   Neutron server starts/restarts.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/599980
[2] /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini

Co-Authored-By: Matt Peters <matt.peters@windriver.com>

Partially-implements: blueprint network-segment-range-management
Change-Id: I8cc0ed77603a5d430c6d7b2b503c7b5a80ed0051

commit_message:
Apply cmd2 upper bound to python3

The recent cmd2 releases have also broken python3. While it gets sorted,
apply the exclusion across the board, not just to python2.

Related-Bug: 1810213
Change-Id: I56f5451735327dc56a703b7725c60f254bf8868c

commit_message:
Fix toggle action of packages

In package page, there are two bugs:
1. toggle active and toggle public button text won't change.
2. toast only shows "Toggled Public" or "Toggled Active" even you toggle packages to private or inactive.

Change-Id: I5e984a408f3099f715f51af0483732863967df1f

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2019-01-06 09:09:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-01-07 14:56:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

LGTM. Neither deliverable has the stable policy tag so the fact that there are requirements changes in the vitrage release is only an issue if the team is going to want to add that tag in the future.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-01-08 09:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Looks good to me.

As Doug says the addition of tenacity is only a problem if the Vitrage team would like to assert the stable tag in the future.'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2019-01-08 10:00:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi, I believe we *do* want to add the stable policy tag, so I'd like to better understand your comments about it.

vitrage was using tenacity for a long time, but it was missing from its requirements. We didn't notice it, probably because we got it from the requirements of another project. At a certain stage we started getting errors that the module is missing, so we explicitly added it to vitrage requirements. 

Is there a way to workaround it? we have important bug fixes in stable/rocky branch, but I think they won't pass the gate without the requirement update."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-01-08 12:53:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow+1

> Hi, I believe we *do* want to add the stable policy tag, so I'd
 > like to better understand your comments about it.
 > 
 > vitrage was using tenacity for a long time, but it was missing from
 > its requirements. We didn't notice it, probably because we got it
 > from the requirements of another project. At a certain stage we
 > started getting errors that the module is missing, so we explicitly
 > added it to vitrage requirements.
 > 
 > Is there a way to workaround it? we have important bug fixes in
 > stable/rocky branch, but I think they won't pass the gate without
 > the requirement update.

If the dependency was always really there, then you have a couple of options. You could let us know that when the question is raised, like you've done here. Or, you could ensure that the commit message on the patch that fixes the problem [1] includes that level of detail so the reviewers of these release requests don't need to ask. :-)

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/00/627900/2/check/releases-tox-list-changes/2d1e2ae/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-01-06_08_40_33_771947"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-01-08 12:59:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I am curious too.

If I am not mistaken, the addition of a requirement is not strictly forbidden, but not advised.

So you could keep the addition of the requirement, however you need to use a different version for this deliverable, bumping the Y in X.Y.Z format. Which is what was done here.
What's the issue?"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-01-08 13:00:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Fix rally deployment config to rally 1.3.0

This PS fixed rally deployment config to latest format. After rally
refactoring, the deployment config format has been simplified, and the
old format is no longer available. The rally deployment config used by
the helm-toolkit also needs to be changed to support the latest rally.

Change-Id: I490fe0cde8f0f53bb93e3b69633e8e48af39bdb3
Related-Id: I380a976c0f48c4af0796c9d866fc8787025ce548

for manila-tempest-tests.

subject: Add support to use existing server_group_id
messages:
[{'account_id': 26463, 'date': '2018-12-20 08:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26463, 'date': '2018-12-20 08:51:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26463, 'date': '2019-01-02 05:44:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2019-01-02 06:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

If the resource is created and managed outside heat, I think you can use external_id[1] rather than changing this resource plugin.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/heat/latest/template_guide/hot_spec.html#resources-section'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-01-02 07:48:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

From a Heat perspective this makes no sense and I don't know why you believe it is necessary.

get_resource on a server group just returns the ID. So if you want to use an existing one then the steps are simple:

1. use the ID directly wherever you would have used get_resource
2. there is no step 2

There's not even any point using external_id (although you could), because OS::Nova::ServerGroup doesn't even have any attributes that you could get from get_attr, so the only thing you can get is the ID, which you already have.

If you want to conditionally create the resource depending on whether an ID is passed in, use a conditional resource.

If you want to validate that the group exists, create a custom constraint that you can specify on the parameter. (There is currently no nova.server_group constraint, but I would happily +2 it if you added one.)

I'm happy to answer any questions you have about how to implement those approaches. Feel free to drop by #heat or start a mailing list thread describing the problem you're trying to solve."}, {'account_id': 26463, 'date': '2019-01-09 05:56:36.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Removed server_group_id changes.
In our use case, operator will create a new lease in Blazar which returns
"server_group_id" in the response which we wanted to specify in tacker
VNFD template.
But blazar is going to depricate this server_group_id in future release and 
handle the impact with placement api.
Ref: https://docs.openstack.org/blazar/latest/specs/rocky/placement-api.html'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-20 08:03:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add support to use existing server_group_id

Heat creates a new server_group for `OS::Nova:ServerGroup` hot resource
type. This patch adds support to specify server_group_id if user wants
to re-use any existing server_group created for any specific purpose.
In this case, ServerGroup will validate if the specified
server_group_id is present in nova. If server_group_id is not
specified, it will create a new one as it is existing today.

Note: We need this feature in tacker as explained in specs [1]. In our
use case, operator will create a new lease in Blazar which returns
"server_group_id" in the response which we want to specify in tacker
VNFD template.

We have made changes to the heat-translator project in patch [2] in
which server_group_id will be set in properties which will be made
available in heat in ServerGroup hot resource.

[1] : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561840

commit_message:
Add support to use existing server_group_id

Heat creates a new server_group for `OS::Nova:ServerGroup` hot resource
type. This patch adds support to specify server_group_id if user wants
to re-use any existing server_group created for any specific purpose.
In this case, ServerGroup will validate if the specified
server_group_id is present in nova. If server_group_id is not
specified, it will create a new one as it is existing today.

Note: We need this feature in tacker as explained in specs [1]. In our
use case, operator will create a new lease in Blazar which returns
"server_group_id" in the response which we want to specify in tacker
VNFD template.

We have made changes to the heat-translator project in patch [2] in
which server_group_id will be set in properties which will be made
available in heat in ServerGroup hot resource.

(1 comment)

@Pete'}, {'account_id': 21830, 'date': '2018-08-06 07:04:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

kolla rally is not usable since rally 1.0.
Because since rally 1.0, rally exists as a test framework, and rally_openstack is released as a plug-in to test openstack, but kolla is making rally image instead of rally_openstack without this context.
so we needed to use rally-openstack provided from openstack/rally project, 
However, rally_openstack also has a bug that rally_openstack doesn't have pymysql library so it can't use mysql, so I added that library and builded image."}, {'account_id': 21830, 'date': '2018-08-10 04:51:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 21830, 'date': '2018-10-04 00:39:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21830, 'date': '2018-12-19 08:55:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-12-19 17:12:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Upgrade rally to 1.3.0

Since rally 1.0, rally has been a platform for testing, and rally for
openstack has been separated by rally-openstack. The current version
of rally in openstack-helm is version 0.8 which corresponds to ocata.
This patch tests with the latest version of rally-openstack, version
1.3.0, and removes scenarios that are no longer in use.

Change-Id: I380a976c0f48c4af0796c9d866fc8787025ce548

commit_message:
Add the ironic_dnsmasq_dhcp_range prechecks for Ironic Dnsmasq

When deploy ironic, the ironic_dnsmasq keep restaring if
ironic_dnsmasq_dhcp_range is missing, so it necessary to add a
prechecks to ensure it be set.

Change-Id: I0c1d91f62f4e5dad2d9a45a2a7bb51b5121dbfda
(cherry picked from commit e5edf98266a3c679b99bc0ca497291590acce715)

commit_message:
Mount journal files as default

Fluent-bit always generate FileNotFound errors at start, due to absence
of journal file inside of the docker env. This PS fix the problems by
adding mounts for journal files

bug report: #1796633

Change-Id: Ic2459986eb0d3560a6af8be6d7a4c3b76e093fec

commit_message:
Adds a simple golang udp server

This will add a simple udp server to the http server
which recieves packets and counts them. It will also
send back a udp message with the id.

Change-Id: Ia65df76747fd6b9fc74d9799a86ee9c30e297fbe

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-02 14:47:08.000000000', 'message': 'Enhance the shibboleth guide

Update, reorganize and clean up the shibboleth guide. Remove the full
example of shibboleth2.xml, it does not add anything useful and just
creates clutter. Use the systemctl command to modernize the service
management commands. Add examples of configuring all required endpoints
in Apache to mirror the new section on configuring protected endpoints
in the main guide and replace the lost examples from the consolidated
WebSSO guide. Add a section on configuring REMOTE_USER and
attributes-map.xml. Remove use of ``a2enmod`` since the Shibboleth
module is automatically enabled by the package on all supported distros.

Partial-bug: #1793374

Change-Id: I0eed3420aa49fdc75349a467e91f8e7f22b075e9

commit_message:
Enhance the shibboleth guide

Update, reorganize and clean up the shibboleth guide. Remove the full
example of shibboleth2.xml, it does not add anything useful and just
creates clutter. Use the systemctl command to modernize the service
management commands. Add examples of configuring all required endpoints
in Apache to mirror the new section on configuring protected endpoints
in the main guide and replace the lost examples from the consolidated
WebSSO guide. Add a section on configuring REMOTE_USER and
attributes-map.xml. Remove use of ``a2enmod`` since the Shibboleth
module is automatically enabled by the package on all supported distros.

Partial-bug: #1793374

Change-Id: I0eed3420aa49fdc75349a467e91f8e7f22b075e9

Prior to this commit, `sushy-emulator` could only be configured
through command-line options and a couple of environment variables.

commit_message:
Add configuration file to sushy-emulator

Prior to this commit, `sushy-emulator` could only be configured
through command-line options and a couple of environment variables.
This proved to be inefficient with the growth of functionality
and configuration options to support it.

This commit introduces configuration file support based entirely
on Flask's configuration file feature. Presently supported
`sushy-emulator` command-line options have been reflected in the
configuration file.

Flask app's options could also be set in the same configuration file
as described in Flask documentation.

Story: 2004305
Task: 27866
Change-Id: Ie6ce173cd8d72874cd6da141b7164f20ebaf0f3f

commit_message:
simple-init: allow for NetworkManager support

This plumbs through an "--use-nm" flag to glean which instructs it to
setup interface bringup with NetworkManager rather than legacy network
enablement scripts.

In this case, install the NetworkManager package.  In the non-nm case,
also install the network-scripts for Fedora 29 -- this has stopped
being installed by default (it's been deprecated since forever).

As noted in the docs, this is currently really only relevant on the
supported rpm distros which are using the ifcfg-rh NetworkManager
plugin to effectively re-use old config files.  However,
NetworkManager has similar plugins for other platforms, so support can
be expanded if changes are proposed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/618964
Change-Id: I4d76e88ce25e5675fd5ef48924acd09915a62a4b

[{'created': '2018-11-20 23:39:51.000000000', 'message': 'package-installs: provide for skip from env var

Provide a "skip_when" option that provides for not installing packages
based on a = or != match on an environment variable.

Change-Id: Ifa824dccaff69fd447f45d54cb4a3083bcabdd86
'}, {'created': '2018-11-21 17:21:44.000000000', 'message': 'package-installs: provide for skip from env var

commit_message:
package-installs: provide for skip from env var

Provide a "when" option that provides for not installing packages
based on a = or != match on an environment variable.

Unit tests are added.

Change-Id: Ifa824dccaff69fd447f45d54cb4a3083bcabdd86

commit_message:
Enhance the openidc guide

Update, reorganize and clean up the openidc guide. Use Google as a
concrete IdP example. Use the systemctl command to modernize the service
management commands. Add examples of configuring all required endpoints
in Apache to mirror the new section on configuring protected endpoints
in the main guide and replace the lost examples from the consolidated
WebSSO guide. Remove use of ``a2enmod`` since the Mellon module is
automatically enabled by the package on all supported distros.

Closes-bug: #1793374

Change-Id: Ie5dc4899beff77f121cc62bc8d56763c7671ecc3

commit_message:
Enhance the mellon guide

Update, reorganize and clean up the mellon guide. Use the systemctl
command to modernize the service management commands. Add examples of
configuring all required endpoints in Apache to mirror the new section
on configuring protected endpoints in the main guide and replace the
lost examples from the consolidated WebSSO guide. Remove use of
``a2enmod`` since the Mellon module is automatically enabled by the
package on all supported distros.

Partial-bug: #1793374

Change-Id: If17d8e73688775b8aeae88f5d0907273bc8de193

commit_message:
Implement system admin role in project API

This commit introduces the system admin role to the projects API,
making it consistent with other system-admin policy definitions.

Subsequent patches will build on this work to expose more
functionality to domain users:

 - domain reader functionality
 - domain member test coverage
 - domain admin functionality
 - project user test coverage

Change-Id: Iceed65d34a8a7cff8841000d7703b1a48e95bb24
Closes-Bug: 1805403
Related-Bug: 1750660
Related-Bug: 1806762

commit_message:
Implement system member role project test coverage

This commit introduces explicit test coverage for system members,
making sure they are allowed to do readable and not writable project
operations.

Subsequent patches will incorporate:

  - system admin functionality
  - domain reader functionality
  - domain member test coverage
  - domain admin functionality
  - project user test coverage

Change-Id: I69ff308ea528d54e0db8e475d047e3dbf356ed2f
Related-Bug: 1805403
Related-Bug: 1750660
Related-Bug: 1806762

[{'created': '2018-12-10 22:23:43.000000000', 'message': 'Implement system reader role for projects

This commit introduces the system reader role to the project API, making
it easier for administrators to delegate subsets of responsibilities
to the API by default. This commit also maintains the ability for
any user to be able to fetch their own projects.

Subsequent patches will incorporate:

  - system member test coverage
  - system admin functionality
  - domain reader functionality
  - domain member test coverage
  - domain admin functionality
  - project user test coverage

commit_message:
Implement system reader role for projects

This commit introduces the system reader role to the project API, making
it easier for administrators to delegate subsets of responsibilities
to the API by default.

Subsequent patches will incorporate:

  - system member test coverage
  - system admin functionality
  - domain reader functionality
  - domain member test coverage
  - domain admin functionality
  - project user test coverage

Change-Id: I089ada1e314688e60f9041095138bc53cd465fa0
Related-Bug: 1805403
Related-Bug: 1750660
Related-Bug: 1806762

commit_message:
Define missing policies for attributes with enforce_policy

Some attributes defined with enforce_policy True in the API
definitions are missing in the in-code policy definiton.
This commit adds them.

Partially Implements: blueprint neutron-policy-in-code

Change-Id: I820d6c95e9af7959b4edfc6557862a5b2c236ee7

    Baremetal nodes fail to pxe boot during OpenStack deployment.
    Reason of this failure is because we are not checking the
    actual pxe device interface and updating the port pxe_enabled field.

    This patch make sure that everytime when port is created, it checks the

"}, {'created': '2018-12-18 06:36:23.000000000', 'message': "Fix OOB introspection to use pxe_enabled flag in idrac driver

Baremetal nodes fail to pxe boot during OpenStack deployment.
Reason of this failure is because we are not checking the
actual pxe device interface and updating the port pxe_enabled field.

This patch make sure that everytime when port is created, it checks the
the BIOS and UEFI boot modes of node and fetch the pxe device interfaces
values matching to nic id and then update the port's pxe_enabled field.

Change-Id: I2890bf16110b713e269d4a4fe410f57273dc8e83
Story: 2004340
(cherry picked from commit 2b74d940c932c1bb4498f47372c0545e4480799f)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix OOB introspection to use pxe_enabled flag in idrac driver

Baremetal nodes fail to pxe boot during OpenStack deployment.
Reason of this failure is because we are not checking the
actual pxe device interface and updating the port pxe_enabled field.

This patch make sure that everytime when port is created, it checks the
the BIOS and UEFI boot modes of node and fetch the pxe device interfaces
values matching to nic id and then update the port's pxe_enabled field.

Change-Id: I2890bf16110b713e269d4a4fe410f57273dc8e83
Story: 2004340
(cherry picked from commit 2b74d940c932c1bb4498f47372c0545e4480799f)

Change-Id: I3544c4ab3bf78feea36fed63a6d799ed4bb43d5a

commit_message:
Fixup some issues of Inspur AS13000 cinder driver

Although Inspur AS13000 cinder driver has been merged,
some small issues have been left there, and this patch
is a follow-up for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562977.

Change-Id: I3544c4ab3bf78feea36fed63a6d799ed4bb43d5a
Closes-Bug: #1810709

commit_message:
api-ref: fix some issues in volumes interfaces

1. group_id is missing from the response of list-voluems and create_volume.

2. shared_targets and service_uuid are new in 3.48

3. migration_status, os-vol-host-attr:host, os-vol-mig-status-attr:migstat,
   and os-vol-mig-status-attr:name_id may not always be present, so they
   should be optional parameters.

https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/index.html?expanded=reset-a-backup-s-status-detail,update-a-backup-detail,create-a-backup-detail#create-a-volume
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/index.html?expanded=reset-a-backup-s-status-detail,update-a-backup-detail,create-a-backup-detail#show-a-volume-s-details

Change-Id: I11201f2a604818e633eb2000b3c69162c668721d

[{'created': '2019-01-07 22:16:09.000000000', 'message': 'Retry on DBDeadLock affecting worker updates

Some updates on the workers table are prone to race conditions,
leading to DB deadlocks.

For example, when creating a large amount of volumes simultaneously,
some of them may hang in "Creating" state due to this issue.

We'll perform some retries when db deadlocks occur.

Change-Id: Iae211acd619070405f84a84ea58e88723a5e9f9b
Closes-Bug: #1789106
(cherry picked from commit e1fc723db123651ad66a339d559aed578126c74a)
(cherry picked from commit 781e964d6c5be7cafa7bc0a295bdc0c37764d939)
'}]
commit_message:
Retry on DBDeadLock affecting worker updates

Some updates on the workers table are prone to race conditions,
leading to DB deadlocks.

For example, when creating a large amount of volumes simultaneously,
some of them may hang in "Creating" state due to this issue.

We'll perform some retries when db deadlocks occur.

Change-Id: Iae211acd619070405f84a84ea58e88723a5e9f9b
Closes-Bug: #1789106
(cherry picked from commit e1fc723db123651ad66a339d559aed578126c74a)
(cherry picked from commit 781e964d6c5be7cafa7bc0a295bdc0c37764d939)

commit_message:
Add missing backup status in API doc

The status 'error_deleting' and 'deleted' doesn't exist in the doc.
Also the status error_restoring is a state of the volume, not backup.
This patch is to add and remove the respective statuses in the doc.

Change-Id: I96cd3d6fba38206a0a2b6c325092903b760b4ed4

commit_message:
Fix retype notifier test case (BackupNFSTestCase)

When we do backup for a volume, the backup notification is called
periodically, but if we do other operations (like retype operation)
in parallel, there is a possible to record the "volume.retype" and
"backup.createprogress".

This patch try to mock the send notification methods to ensure this
doesn't happen.

Change-Id: Iad899944b54a0556ff0a946d18fcdb7e1680de69
Closes-Bug: #1803648

Look for lower-case hostname when adding to ssh_known_hosts

case discrepancies.

Partial-Bug: 1809273

Fix destination_type attribute in the bdm_v2 documentation

All the clients using block device mapping are using the attribute
destination_type and the documentation points to dest_type instead.

[{'created': '2019-01-07 13:04:24.000000000', 'message': 'Removing pip-missing-reqs from default tox jobs

Change I1b02384494ae9f440b72b98d9ae5f31d88dc8967 removed the
tox env entry for pip-missing-reqs but did not remove the job
from the envlist.

This means that if you run tox with no args it will run that job,
using the default venv setup with takes time but runs no tests.

Change-Id: I8355372da93b93cc1c7f7a1501af0fbd01eee615
(cherry picked from commit a8253805dffb5598c311c23b854f987a18e69a15)
'}]
commit_message:
Removing pip-missing-reqs from default tox jobs

Change I1b02384494ae9f440b72b98d9ae5f31d88dc8967 removed the
tox env entry for pip-missing-reqs but did not remove the job
from the envlist.

This means that if you run tox with no args it will run that job,
using the default venv setup with takes time but runs no tests.

Change-Id: I8355372da93b93cc1c7f7a1501af0fbd01eee615
(cherry picked from commit a8253805dffb5598c311c23b854f987a18e69a15)

commit_message:
Correct typo in config option choices

A typo in the oslo.config 'choices' for the output_format config
option definition for the image conversion plugin in the
interoperable image import workflow prevents conversion to the
vmdk format.  This patch corrects the typo and regenerates the
sample image import conf file.

Change-Id: I1836a46d969aab8ce09967db63d66f215d2cc920
Closes-bug: #1809462
Related-bug: #1805765
(cherry picked from commit a22f02b653399bc495b85db1d6106c0e790edfe7)

commit_message:
Workaround ssh_known_hosts changes not being propagated to containers

We need an in-place update of /etc/ssh/ssh_known_hosts for the changes to be
visible to running containers. This works around the issue until we have a
better long-term solution - make a copy, update using lineinfile, then
clobber the original file.

Closes-bug: #1810932
Change-Id: Ie6af5908d4b79bad094bce31e8e853678c0e843c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-18 11:14:29.000000000', 'message': "Fail to live migration if instance has a NUMA topology

Live migration is currently totally broken if a NUMA topology is
present. This affects everything that's been regrettably stuffed in with
NUMA topology including CPU pinning, hugepage support and emulator
thread support. Side effects can range from simple unexpected
performance hits (due to instances running on the same cores) to
complete failures (due to instance cores or huge pages being mapped to
CPUs/NUMA nodes that don't exist on the destination host).

Until such a time as we resolve these issues, we should alert users to
the fact that such issues exist. A workaround option is provided for
operators that _really_ need the broken behavior, but it's defaulted to
False to highlight the brokenness of this feature to unsuspecting
operators.

Conflicts:
	nova/conf/workarounds.py
	nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/admin_only_action_common.py
	nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_migrate_server.py

NOTE(stephenfin): Conflicts due to removal of
'report_ironic_standard_resource_class_inventory' option and addition of
change Iaea1cb4ed93bb98f451de4f993106d7891ca3682 on master.

Change-Id: I217fba9138132b107e9d62895d699d238392e761
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Related-bug: #1289064
(cherry picked from commit ae2e5650d14a2c81dd397727d67b60f9b8dd0dd7)
"}]
commit_message:
Fail to live migration if instance has a NUMA topology

Live migration is currently totally broken if a NUMA topology is
present. This affects everything that's been regrettably stuffed in with
NUMA topology including CPU pinning, hugepage support and emulator
thread support. Side effects can range from simple unexpected
performance hits (due to instances running on the same cores) to
complete failures (due to instance cores or huge pages being mapped to
CPUs/NUMA nodes that don't exist on the destination host).

Until such a time as we resolve these issues, we should alert users to
the fact that such issues exist. A workaround option is provided for
operators that _really_ need the broken behavior, but it's defaulted to
False to highlight the brokenness of this feature to unsuspecting
operators.

Conflicts:
	nova/conf/workarounds.py
	nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/admin_only_action_common.py
	nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_migrate_server.py

NOTE(stephenfin): Conflicts due to removal of
'report_ironic_standard_resource_class_inventory' option and addition of
change Iaea1cb4ed93bb98f451de4f993106d7891ca3682 on master.

Change-Id: I217fba9138132b107e9d62895d699d238392e761
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Related-bug: #1289064
(cherry picked from commit ae2e5650d14a2c81dd397727d67b60f9b8dd0dd7)

commit_message:
undercloud: enable the ipxe boot interface by default

Ironic is separating the pxe and ipxe implementations into separate boot
interfaces, deprecating the ipxe part of the pxe interface. This change
enables the new ipxe interface instead.

Change-Id: I386ce69e2a2f3d9bcea2eead16802b9a54f04265
Story: #1628069

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Iaae3bad2604d6b2d6a3de1cffdae3680d1869fde

the register-indexes job

Change-Id: Icd8678debb3dd9620548c6a7c5f02dbb1da048ba
'}]
commit_message:
Kibana: Include kernel and journal indexes in register job

This updates the Kibana chart to include the kernel and journal
indexes as part of the default indexes that get registered with
the register-indexes job

Change-Id: Icd8678debb3dd9620548c6a7c5f02dbb1da048ba

commit_message:
Follow up "Fix up userdata argument to rebuild"

This patch is a follow-up patch for
I9752d849aa0e6cf608db0def3ca89565cff4debc.

* Add checking a message of an exception in the unit test
* Add 'with' statement when opening a file
* Fix descriptions in the release note

Change-Id: I2c399490f320a202b41a8f8d36710a36621c4853
(cherry picked from commit 47dc339ab9bb2985d750dae11d0b3b8b2c85d2b2)

commit_message:
Add excludes to container image build

Sometimes it would be beneficial to not build a specific container that
we might normally build. This change adds an --exclude option that can
be used to skip a container when passing it to kolla-build.

Change-Id: Ia871e0a46078a33270516f98ec0e08c1c3a0b43f
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/624530/

commit_message:
Fix up userdata argument to rebuild.

This was using the name of the file as user data as opposed
to the content of the file.

Change-Id: I9752d849aa0e6cf608db0def3ca89565cff4debc
Closes-bug: #1794419
(cherry picked from commit cac7351b0ee9716f1be01e8711d6ed3a237362ca)

commit_message:
Replace scenario001-multinode with scenario001-standalone

The scenario001-standalone job is added in the depends-on below.
Tracked by tripleo ci squad at [1]

Also adds scenario002/3 standalone and adds 1-4 into the
gate jobs too

[1] https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/191
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/619508

Change-Id: I2811a1de8f51ce5c1dcdb6738fdc12297c1883b6

commit_message:
Updating plugin documentation and release notes

Updating documentation to reflect what it means to the Sahara project,
and make it build again.
Also cleaning up release notes so we can start fresh.

commit_message:
Make hard linking tripleo-ci idempotent

This step can be run multiple times in envs
like the reproducer.
Add a check condition before running this
step again.

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/354
Change-Id: Iaf2b9d56b5012ae60b236b58b9bd093a8b13aec6

Test feature sets with downstream

- Add explicit --nodes option to quickstart.sh call
- Modify fs001 and fs035 to work with downstream

commit_message:
WIP: Add a new role to clone repos and include zuul changes

This role is needed for the reproducer to include
zuul changes in repos before any pre or provision
playbooks are run.

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/373
Change-Id: Ida05552c2ce467d66069093b7074c7440b4e91c7

commit_message:
WIP: Rewrite nodepool-setup role to be used with v3 playbooks

 - Remove tasks that are executed in pre playbooks
with zuul v3.
 - Modify test env to run zuul tasks
 - Modify inventory to work with test env
 - Add ansible cfg to find zuul filters

Change-Id: I597ea7b057790536254d12398aa2557f8b53a93b

commit_message:
Make zuul inventory available for the reproducer

The reproducer will need the vars stored in this
file to run the pre playbooks.

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/349
Change-Id: Iec50bbb3096bd7d94188eafbc33b957099437766

commit_message:
DNM - Use ready rendered templates for reproducer

When running run-v3 within the reproducer, use the ready
rendered files from the logs rather than regenerate
them from .j2 templates to keep vars the same as the
job run itself.

Change-Id: I5e9a0a5b6643a2e1706f2d7c94cf43300e2dfae2

commit_message:
Increase size for security hardened images

With the move to containers there has been an increase of
demand on the /var volume. Increase the global size, as well
as give more percentage to /var and reduce /root.

Also fix fsck-passno setting, that was incorrectly set.

Change-Id: I8d820f668ffffe5993d5fef38e0c1e8c5f5862ec
Depends-On: Ib806bac815077c2508060719469b5d0f1acc0f99
(cherry picked from commit aa19a7f92af8d7683b84221550f3850ceec85363)
(cherry picked from commit 9f1c8002385be0173dee1b5c6e2ce33530c20101)

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 9b788cd874ddf142745ce9e94d830f5708087f81'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-01-08 13:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2019-01-08 16:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-08 10:04:47.000000000', 'message': 'Do not dereference .stdout if dmidecode is missing

In 459b2664d99befa452e1946a4e4cf400183dd9e3 (Handle missing or bad
dmidecode) we accept return values of 0, 1 or 2 from command modules
that call 'dmidecode'.  However we then unconditionally look at the
stdout key in the result object.  When the dmidecode binary is missing
the result dictionary from the command module doesn't contain a stdout
key (resulting in something like):

---
fatal: [overcloud-novacomputeppc64le-1]: FAILED! => {"msg": "The task includes an option with an undefined variable. The error was: 'dict object' has no attribute 'stdout'\n\nThe error appears to have been in '/var/lib/mistral/overcloud/ceph-ansible/nodes_uuid_playbook.yml': line 14, column 7, but may\nbe elsewhere in the file depending on the exact syntax problem.\n\nThe offending line appears to be:\n\n      failed_when: machine_uuid.rc not in [0, 1, 2]\n    - name: generate host vars from nodes data\n      ^ here\n"}
---

This change just adds a default('') filter to the lookup so a missing
key will fallback to an empty dictionary

    Change-Id: I6a6f9feb95a2ef26d2f5ea94af84eb8814069654
    Resolves: rhbz#1658014

Change-Id: I7db180674c3696508a7f449e2e825e7083a00f6e
'}, {'created': '2019-01-08 10:12:24.000000000', 'message': 'Do not dereference .stdout if dmidecode is missing

In 459b2664d99befa452e1946a4e4cf400183dd9e3 (Handle missing or bad
dmidecode) we accept return values of 0, 1 or 2 from command modules
that call 'dmidecode'.  However we then unconditionally look at the
stdout key in the result object.  When the dmidecode binary is missing
the result dictionary from the command module doesn't contain a stdout
key (resulting in something like):

---
fatal: [overcloud-novacomputeppc64le-1]: FAILED! => {"msg": "The task includes an option with an undefined variable. The error was: 'dict object' has no attribute 'stdout'\n\nThe error appears to have been in '/var/lib/mistral/overcloud/ceph-ansible/nodes_uuid_playbook.yml': line 14, column 7, but may\nbe elsewhere in the file depending on the exact syntax problem.\n\nThe offending line appears to be:\n\n      failed_when: machine_uuid.rc not in [0, 1, 2]\n    - name: generate host vars from nodes data\n      ^ here\n"}
---

This change just adds a default('') filter to the lookup so a missing
key will fallback to an empty dictionary

Related-Bug: 1790447
Change-Id: I7db180674c3696508a7f449e2e825e7083a00f6e
'}, {'created': '2019-01-08 13:21:44.000000000', 'message': 'Do not dereference .stdout if dmidecode is missing

In 459b2664d99befa452e1946a4e4cf400183dd9e3 (Handle missing or bad
dmidecode) we accept return values of 0, 1 or 2 from command modules
that call 'dmidecode'.  However we then unconditionally look at the
stdout key in the result object.  When the dmidecode binary is missing
the result dictionary from the command module doesn't contain a stdout
key (resulting in something like):

---
fatal: [overcloud-novacomputeppc64le-1]: FAILED! => {"msg": "The task includes an option with an undefined variable. The error was: 'dict object' has no attribute 'stdout'\n\nThe error appears to have been in '/var/lib/mistral/overcloud/ceph-ansible/nodes_uuid_playbook.yml': line 14, column 7, but may\nbe elsewhere in the file depending on the exact syntax problem.\n\nThe offending line appears to be:\n\n      failed_when: machine_uuid.rc not in [0, 1, 2]\n    - name: generate host vars from nodes data\n      ^ here\n"}
---

This change just adds a default('') filter to the lookup so a missing
key will fallback to an empty dictionary

Closes-Bug: 1790447
Change-Id: I7db180674c3696508a7f449e2e825e7083a00f6e
'}]
commit_message:
Do not dereference .stdout if dmidecode is missing

In 459b2664d99befa452e1946a4e4cf400183dd9e3 (Handle missing or bad
dmidecode) we accept return values of 0, 1 or 2 from command modules
that call 'dmidecode'.  However we then unconditionally look at the
stdout key in the result object.  When the dmidecode binary is missing
the result dictionary from the command module doesn't contain a stdout
key (resulting in something like):

---
fatal: [overcloud-novacomputeppc64le-1]: FAILED! => {"msg": "The task includes an option with an undefined variable. The error was: 'dict object' has no attribute 'stdout'\n\nThe error appears to have been in '/var/lib/mistral/overcloud/ceph-ansible/nodes_uuid_playbook.yml': line 14, column 7, but may\nbe elsewhere in the file depending on the exact syntax problem.\n\nThe offending line appears to be:\n\n      failed_when: machine_uuid.rc not in [0, 1, 2]\n    - name: generate host vars from nodes data\n      ^ here\n"}
---

This change just adds a default('') filter to the lookup so a missing
key will fallback to an empty dictionary

Closes-Bug: 1790447
Change-Id: I7db180674c3696508a7f449e2e825e7083a00f6e

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-12 21:20:20.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Id1f44990151934be8ecbdc33e1f1c855e2ad7b39
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Id1f44990151934be8ecbdc33e1f1c855e2ad7b39

commit_message:
[CEPH] select the RGW backend based on RGW version

Use the Beast backend only when Mimic binaries are installed.
Otherwise use civitweb if the binares are from Ceph Luminous.

Change-Id: Ia7cb64d8db7eed2fc0c57387b26a27163af34520

subject: Skip deliverable checks if not deliverables changed
messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-09-23 03:25:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-09-23 03:30:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-09-24 14:46:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:\n\nThis is probably OK, but having the jobs run even when deliverables aren't changed does let us test the code against all of the old deliverable files. Maybe we want to add the code directories (openstack_releases and tools) to the list of important files?"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-08 20:47:36.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-23 03:25:36.000000000', 'message': 'Only run openstack-tox-validate when deliverables have changed

This job is only useful when there are new releases. Otherwise it spins
up a VM, installs system packages, installs Python packages, and parses
all the deliverable files only to print out the message:

WARNING: no modified deliverable files

Change-Id: I1507a44277bfe6e9bc9efb3cdc7deb1c4b28f145
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-09-23 03:30:11.000000000', 'message': 'Skip deliverable checks if not deliverables changed

openstack-tox-validate and openstack-tox-listchanges are
only useful when there are new releases. Otherwise they spin
up a VM, installs system packages, installs Python packages, and parses
all the deliverable files only to print out the message:

WARNING: no modified deliverable files

or:

no modified deliverable files, skipping report

Since our unit test jobs run when these commands themselves have
changed, no reason to try to run the commands without deliverable
changes.

Change-Id: I1507a44277bfe6e9bc9efb3cdc7deb1c4b28f145
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Skip deliverable checks if not deliverables changed

openstack-tox-validate and openstack-tox-listchanges are
only useful when there are new releases. Otherwise they spin
up a VM, installs system packages, installs Python packages, and parses
all the deliverable files only to print out the message:

WARNING: no modified deliverable files

or:

no modified deliverable files, skipping report

Since our unit test jobs run when these commands themselves have
changed, no reason to try to run the commands without deliverable
changes.

Change-Id: I1507a44277bfe6e9bc9efb3cdc7deb1c4b28f145
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix IPv6 iPXE support

Adds transmission of an `ipxe6` tag to neutron which is required
for neutron to appropriately match and supply configuration to
hosts over DHCPv6 when iPXE is in use.

This is because neutron prepends options based upon its
perception of the IP version being used and the detection of
iPXE actively being used varries between IPv4 and IPv6.

Story: 2004502
Task: 28221

Change-Id: If68926fd215f707394e5d6a0af9daa9232216abe

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-10 09:44:34.000000000', 'message': 'VNX: Add constraints for async migration

Async migration was introduced to accelerate the cloning of volumes (
The cloned volumes can be accessed after the migrations start, no need
to wait them for finishing).

However, before migrations finish, snapshots cannot be created on the
source volumes any more, which could affect the follow-up clone from the
same source volumes. That is the constraint of async migration.

The fix is adding the constraint to the doc of VNX driver. And give
users some advises on how to make the follow-up volume clone work.

Change-Id: I6ad3c6b967d5a33966b40c3a54c0f110576c8d87
Closes-bug: #1796825
'}, {'created': '2018-10-11 01:45:35.000000000', 'message': 'VNX: Add constraints for async migration

Async migration was introduced to accelerate the cloning of volume (
The cloned volume can be accessed after the migration starts, no need
to wait it for finishing).

However, before the migration finishes, snapshots cannot be created from
the source volume any more, which could affect subsequent clones from
the same source volume. That is the constraint of async migration.

The fix is adding the constraint to the doc of VNX driver. And give
users some advises on how to make the subsequent volume clone work.

Change-Id: I6ad3c6b967d5a33966b40c3a54c0f110576c8d87
Closes-bug: #1796825
'}]
commit_message:
VNX: Add constraints for async migration

Async migration was introduced to accelerate the cloning of volume (
The cloned volume can be accessed after the migration starts, no need
to wait it for finishing).

However, before the migration finishes, snapshots cannot be created from
the source volume any more, which could affect subsequent clones from
the same source volume. That is the constraint of async migration.

The fix is adding the constraint to the doc of VNX driver. And give
users some advises on how to make the subsequent volume clone work.

Change-Id: I6ad3c6b967d5a33966b40c3a54c0f110576c8d87
Closes-bug: #1796825

T release onward.

commit_message:
update datatype for "OctaviaFlavorId"

Currently, heat templates will expect OctaviaFlavorId value to
"number". But, if a user specifies alphanum value, the deployment
fails. Hence, updating datatype of "OctaviaFlavorId" to "string"
Closes-Bug: #1810415

Change-Id: I9f1c8c5df61f3070a3df404e9f726ed40f138431

[{'created': '2019-01-08 18:10:16.000000000', 'message': "Adds resource_filters.json distribution

Cinder supposes to see resource_filters.json in
/etc/cinder/resource_filters.json, but role doesn't distribute this file
It implements generalized filters, w/o which non-admins will
experience problems with some operations (i.e in horizon).

Closes-Bug: #1810537
Change-Id: I0f699c9869effc5ccc0d3f79422935975f698134
(cherry picked from commit 5e7e1a7ea982496ea48bfce505fde8e3be98ff89)
"}]
commit_message:
Adds resource_filters.json distribution

Cinder supposes to see resource_filters.json in
/etc/cinder/resource_filters.json, but role doesn't distribute this file
It implements generalized filters, w/o which non-admins will
experience problems with some operations (i.e in horizon).

Closes-Bug: #1810537
Change-Id: I0f699c9869effc5ccc0d3f79422935975f698134
(cherry picked from commit 5e7e1a7ea982496ea48bfce505fde8e3be98ff89)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-03 03:12:27.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate old keystone session config opts

In the past, the options ca_certificates_file,
nova_ca_certificates_file, cinder_ca_certificates_file,
api_insecure, nova_api_insecure, cinder_api_insecure
were supplied to instantiate nova, neutron and cinder
clients. These options have now been subsumed in a more
generic way into the Keystone session logic as 'cafile'
and 'insecure'. Deprecate the older options in Stein so
that we can remove them in a future release.

This deprecation began many releases ago when we switched
to using keystone sessions [1]. However, we were still
overriding the values of "insecure" and "cafile" if provided,
forcing users to continue using deprecated parameters
"api_insecure" and "ca_certificates_file". So despite
this fix originating in the Stein release, it would be
prudent to backport it to all maintained releases and
remove support for these older options in/beyond Train
release (9.0.0).

[1] Ic211a11308a3295409467efd88bff413482ee58d

(cherry picked from commit 4947cb0f6c610d5abf6d34d20bb50febd5b0239b)

commit_message:
Deprecate old keystone session config opts

In the past, the options ca_certificates_file,
nova_ca_certificates_file, cinder_ca_certificates_file,
api_insecure, nova_api_insecure, cinder_api_insecure
were supplied to instantiate nova, neutron and cinder
clients. These options have now been subsumed in a more
generic way into the Keystone session logic as 'cafile'
and 'insecure'. Deprecate the older options in Stein so
that we can remove them in a future release.

This deprecation began many releases ago when we switched
to using keystone sessions [1]. However, we were still
overriding the values of "insecure" and "cafile" if provided,
forcing users to continue using deprecated parameters
"api_insecure" and "ca_certificates_file". So despite
this fix originating in the Stein release, it would be
prudent to backport it to all maintained releases and
remove support for these older options in/beyond Train
release (9.0.0).

[1] Ic211a11308a3295409467efd88bff413482ee58d
Change-Id: I148e9079c7c1ab119f519f727d4ad97758473325
Related-Bug: #1802393
Closes-Bug: #1809318
(cherry picked from commit 198bea78ac01aaf8a703ca7878b2a85a1b59667e)
(cherry picked from commit 4947cb0f6c610d5abf6d34d20bb50febd5b0239b)

[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:51:45.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id511fe5b324e18eef0452029d8cea51f1045c051
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id511fe5b324e18eef0452029d8cea51f1045c051
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Use existing CNF_INCLUDE_DIR to create mysql-flavor directory

Also removed the trailing slash from the path to pass the tests.

subject: Remove some of the excessive rabbitmq bundle logging
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-01-08 14:53:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-01-08 16:52:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-08 14:53:09.000000000', 'message': 'Remove some of the excessive rabbitmq bundle logging

By removing the pam-systemd optinal session line we get rid of the
following line:
pam_systemd(su:session): Failed to connect to system bus: No such file or directory

It is useless inside a container anyway since the pam_systemd module
registers user sessions.

By adding a sufficient pam_succeed_if call fo when the user belongs to the
rabbitmq group we get rid of the following spurious log:
Oct 23 13:52:52 overcloud-controller-0 su: pam_unix(su:session): session opened for user rabbitmq by (uid=0)
Oct 23 13:52:54 overcloud-controller-0 su: pam_unix(su:session): session closed for user rabbitmq

We do not need this inside a container anyway. In the future (w/
pam_unix 1.2.0 and onwards we will be able to use the quiet option
instead).

Depends-On: Ic0789da4645a4ee186d82ad7d943de78d4d5c443

Change-Id: Icd199ca4ce4848c971488d8ab69e668add86b150
Related-Bug: #1806451
(cherry picked from commit 44985bd42d21ce705387c01b188f27711791f51f)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove some of the excessive rabbitmq bundle logging

By removing the pam-systemd optinal session line we get rid of the
following line:
pam_systemd(su:session): Failed to connect to system bus: No such file or directory

It is useless inside a container anyway since the pam_systemd module
registers user sessions.

By adding a sufficient pam_succeed_if call fo when the user belongs to the
rabbitmq group we get rid of the following spurious log:
Oct 23 13:52:52 overcloud-controller-0 su: pam_unix(su:session): session opened for user rabbitmq by (uid=0)
Oct 23 13:52:54 overcloud-controller-0 su: pam_unix(su:session): session closed for user rabbitmq

We do not need this inside a container anyway. In the future (w/
pam_unix 1.2.0 and onwards we will be able to use the quiet option
instead).

Depends-On: Ic0789da4645a4ee186d82ad7d943de78d4d5c443

Change-Id: Icd199ca4ce4848c971488d8ab69e668add86b150
Related-Bug: #1806451
(cherry picked from commit 44985bd42d21ce705387c01b188f27711791f51f)

subject: puppet_config for rabbitmq_bundle needs file_line
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-01-08 14:49:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-01-08 16:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-08 14:49:33.000000000', 'message': 'puppet_config for rabbitmq_bundle needs file_line

The main reason for this change is that in a related puppet-tripleo patch
we will use the file_line puppet class in order to set some parameters
to reduce the excessive rabbitmq logging.

Because this change will be very specific to rabbitmq running in a
container we also need to make sure that we actually use the
rabbitmq_bundle puppet manifest to create config files and not the
more generic one.

Change-Id: Ic0789da4645a4ee186d82ad7d943de78d4d5c443
Related-Bug: #1806451
(cherry picked from commit 34aa23814ed80be7202ae8d92bdae08ad640f861)
'}]
commit_message:
puppet_config for rabbitmq_bundle needs file_line

The main reason for this change is that in a related puppet-tripleo patch
we will use the file_line puppet class in order to set some parameters
to reduce the excessive rabbitmq logging.

Because this change will be very specific to rabbitmq running in a
container we also need to make sure that we actually use the
rabbitmq_bundle puppet manifest to create config files and not the
more generic one.

Change-Id: Ic0789da4645a4ee186d82ad7d943de78d4d5c443
Related-Bug: #1806451
(cherry picked from commit 34aa23814ed80be7202ae8d92bdae08ad640f861)

commit_message:
Add scenarios for certs, containers, and keys

Add barbican scenarios for creating/deleting certificates,
containers, and keys. The scenarios that were added
are:

- BarbicanCertificates.create
- BarbicanCertificates.create_and_delete
- BarbicanKeys.create
- BarbicanKeys.create_and_delete
- BarbicanContainers.list
- BarbicanContainers.create
- BarbicanContainers.create_and_delete

Add arguments to the following scenarios to specify
algorithm and payload:

- BarbicanSecrets.create_and_delete
- BarbicanSecrets.create_and_list
- BarbicanSecrets.create:

Change-Id: I337c79982d66a35a98cc8a5a09c31315ac9d6656
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-24 12:09:38.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Add Network Policy support to services

This patch adds support for Network Policy on services. It
applies pods' security groups onto the services in front of them.
It makes the next assumptions:
- All the pods pointed by one svc have the same labels, thus the same
sgs being enforced
- Only copies the SG rules that have the same protocol and direction
as the listener being created

TODO:
- Ensure traffic to the pods is allowed from the services subnet
- Ensure NP changes are applied to services
- Add unittest
- Optimize the sg_mode create case (i.e., simply applying the SGs)

Partially Implements: blueprint k8s-network-policies

Change-Id: Ibd4b51ff40b69af26ab7e7b81d18e63abddf775b
"}, {'created': '2018-12-24 12:51:57.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Add Network Policy support to services

- Adds a default rule to NP to enable traffic from services subnet CIDR

commit_message:
Add Network Policy support to services

This patch adds support for Network Policy on services. It
applies pods' security groups onto the services in front of them.
It makes the next assumptions:
- All the pods pointed by one svc have the same labels, thus the same
sgs being enforced
- Only copies the SG rules that have the same protocol and direction
as the listener being created
- Adds a default rule to NP to enable traffic from services subnet CIDR

Partially Implements: blueprint k8s-network-policies

commit_message:
Remove support for NetApp E-Series systems

The deprecation notice [1] for this driver in Cinder was issued in
Rocky, so now it is time to remove them from the tree.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2018-July/015521.html

Change-Id: I82cfbacdf572d68dc4e6c21a3d3005bc92344a38

[{'created': '2019-01-07 20:25:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Xtremio driver configuration ordering

Driver was incorrectly moved to a different place in the TOC since it
still had the non-Dell naming. This moves it back and renames it to
hopefully prevent this kind of mistake from happening again.

Change-Id: I797c7cf86dcb2598c04a3697093c458e64d84ae1
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Xtremio driver configuration ordering

Driver was incorrectly moved to a different place in the TOC since it
still had the non-Dell naming. This moves it back and renames it to
hopefully prevent this kind of mistake from happening again.

Change-Id: I797c7cf86dcb2598c04a3697093c458e64d84ae1
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-08 13:13:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix access-rule filter for python3

The manila-tempest-plugin shares client collects access rules
from a rest response body using a filter expression which in
Python 3 is an iterator.  It then attempts to determine the
length of the result and since the full iteration has not
completed, Python throws an exception.

Fix this by using a straightforward list comprehension that
behaves the same way in Python 2 and Python 3.

Closes-bug: #1810937
Change-Id: I20a1f05cd4e2f6bdee8b8e4b069c53e35e41fe70
'}]
commit_message:
Fix access-rule filter for python3

The manila-tempest-plugin shares client collects access rules
from a rest response body using a filter expression which in
Python 3 is an iterator.  It then attempts to determine the
length of the result and since the full iteration has not
completed, Python throws an exception.

Fix this by using a straightforward list comprehension that
behaves the same way in Python 2 and Python 3.

Closes-bug: #1810937
Change-Id: I20a1f05cd4e2f6bdee8b8e4b069c53e35e41fe70

commit_message:
doc: Remove errant newline in the plugin tutorial

{% include %} syntax cannot have a newline.

Closes-Bug: #1774054

This commit also cleans up several things.

* setup.cfg: Rename "classifiers" to the correct keyword "classifier"
* setup.cfg: Add Python 3 classifier
* Quote literals

Change-Id: I14c2217a69ea489c72b311b26b5eb4a5e4865059

commit_message:
Rework orchestration to add update preview

With a slight rework of basic resource and proxy a change can be done
in orchestrate to throw away useless StackPreview class and add
possibility to create/update stack with preview (dry-run) using a
single regular Stack class.
Additionally stack.abandon is added

Task: 28128
Change-Id: I9a0a2a389be04a5cbcc3dd085ef830c58af3c1d0

recheck'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-12-10 15:07:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-12-10 16:42:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

Mostly looks good, but in some places you accept base_path, but do not pass it to the parent call. Was it intended?'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-12-10 16:43:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2018-12-11 07:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2018-12-11 07:34:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> Mostly looks good, but in some places you accept base_path, but do
 > not pass it to the parent call. Was it intended?

Yes, the intention was not to change it, unless it is explicitly needed. In 99% cases it will not even be. If you want I can change in in the followup.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2018-12-11 07:34:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> (1 comment)

screwed my git by cherry-pick and not seen the automatically modified commit message.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2018-12-20 15:18:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2018-12-20 15:21:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-12-24 15:13:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-01-02 17:14:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Workflow+1

(11 comments)

So yeah, I'd prefer that we do use base_path wherever we accept it, even if we don't plan for it to be used in reality. This is to avoid confusing the hell out of innocent readers (including our future selves). I'm fine with a follow-up."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-01-08 15:20:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-30 13:02:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add possibility to override base_path for resource operations

We currently have multiple places, where we inherit resource just to be
able to request it's Details or so under different url. With 619594
a change has been introduced to improve this by having possibility
to override base_path for a single resource operation.
This was done only for list operations. However there are also cases
when such possibility would be nice for create/update/etc operations.
One example is dry-run for heat, where the endpoint receives "/preview"
part. This is currently implemented by creating
additional resource StackPreview with different base_path. For create
it might be ok, but dry-run stack update would require another url.

With this change a possibility to override base_path for individual
operation on resource object is added. It can be given to proxy
function, which would pass it to resource and use it during URI
calculation.

Change-Id: Id8c8212249cb985d2e47eb1d4fb23ebf19b3871b

commit_message:
Add possibility to override base_path for resource operations

We currently have multiple places, where we inherit resource just to be
able to request it's Details or so under different url. With 619594
a change has been introduced to improve this by having possibility
to override base_path for a single resource operation.
This was done only for list operations. However there are also cases
when such possibility would be nice for create/update/etc operations.
One example is dry-run for heat, where the endpoint receives "/preview"
part. This is currently implemented by creating
additional resource StackPreview with different base_path. For create
it might be ok, but dry-run stack update would require another url.

With this change a possibility to override base_path for individual
operation on resource object is added. It can be given to proxy
function, which would pass it to resource and use it during URI
calculation.

Change-Id: Id8c8212249cb985d2e47eb1d4fb23ebf19b3871b

To reduce the number of times the API returns HTTP CONFLICT we retry
acquiring an exclusive lock in TaskManager. However, for the allocation

commit_message:
Allocation API: allow skipping retries in TaskManager

To reduce the number of times the API returns HTTP CONFLICT we retry
acquiring an exclusive lock in TaskManager. However, for the allocation
API it's not desired since we usually have several nodes to work with,
and another node can be picked without waiting for the current one
to become available. The new "retry" argument to TaskManager allows
disabling the retries.

Change-Id: Ia8267b1baa8b671a602e7fc402b7ef083e2ac2ed
Story: #2004341
Task: #28722

commit_message:
Add reflection of RpcPort to health checks

This patch passes RpcPort parameter value to container health check
scripts, which are based on verifying if service is connected to RabbitMQ.

Change-Id: If63f136b5173bb9a94572ea5062a188469c2c782
Closes-Bug: #1782369
(cherry picked from commit 7351b3cc204e9fed8543778bf9d36494b95b3af9)

commit_message:
Updating plugin documentation and release notes

Updating documentation to reflect what it means to the Sahara project,
and make it build again.
Also cleaning up release notes so we can start fresh.

Change-Id: I0bdc5d8fbc0b86fc8e72afb594c11ae6e8fbf91c

commit_message:
Selenium Tests for OSH Infra

This adds scripts using Selenium Webdriver to verify
the dashboards for Gafana, Nagios, and Prometheus are
reachable and functioning as expected. The scripts
create screenshots of each dashboard as well as
pages that can be navigated to.

It also adds the scripts to the gates for the single
and multinode deployments.

Change-Id: I1699e0ba8ff82ce8f59342cc71aad10cff7d2516

[{'created': '2019-01-06 18:48:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Sphinx warnings in existing Cinder specs

Sphinx throws warnings on two of existing spec files:

> cinder-specs/doc/source/specs/liberty/clone-image-in-glance-cinder-backend.rst:173:
  WARNING: Footnote [2] is not referenced.
> cinder-specs/doc/source/specs/newton/discovering-system-capabilities.rst:356:
  WARNING: Footnote [4] is not referenced.

These need to be fixed before we can switch to new way of building specs
as recomended by OpenStack Project Testing Interface:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#documentation

Change-Id: Ibe58c27303f49a72779f0d5ebdd52c001ee8b23c
Closes-Bug: 1810677
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Sphinx warnings in existing Cinder specs

Sphinx throws warnings on two of existing spec files:

> cinder-specs/doc/source/specs/liberty/clone-image-in-glance-cinder-backend.rst:173:
  WARNING: Footnote [2] is not referenced.

as recomended by OpenStack Project Testing Interface:

commit_message:
Support certificate validation

This spec proposes to support validating certificates
when verifying image signatures.

While image signing ensures that image data is obtained
unmodified from Glance, it does not prevent an attacker from
uploading and signing a malicious image. The addition of Cinder
API changes allows Cinder users to control the certificates
which are allowed to sign images.

This is a follow up propose from signature verification [1],
also same as Nova certification validation feature [2].

Partial-Implements: bp certificate-validate

[1]: 1faf87284cf674c52a50a9feff6086c05014185c
[2]: 9f0a8999af83bff14acfb0e1adfbcbdbdc2233e6

Change-Id: I9fbab8948cf4ce2e165841fa7d4f998941516908

The table of contents already shows up to the left side of the
configuration page, so we don't need it explicitly at the top of the

commit_message:
Remove duplicated TOC in configuration guide

The table of contents already shows up to the left side of the
configuration page, so we don't need it explicitly at the top of the
page. Explicitly including the TOC was causing the headers to appear
twice in the admin guide TOC.

Change-Id: I3b29a434ac847060b9709c86b6d72050c016034f

commit_message:
Remove polling from test_create_bridges

It is possible to use ovsdbapp Events to wait for bridges to be
created instead of polling until they exist.

Change-Id: I97f1c15a13a3bb90d774066a9933f3a4d39f50e2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-24 17:07:43.000000000', 'message': 'add local tox targets for pep8 and py3

This patch adds local tox targets for pep8 and python 3 as per [1]
that will install dependencies in editable mode.
To run them use the pep8-dev and py3-dev targets respectively.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-sibling-setup

Change-Id: I29638781271436a425d3ba8bd0f941b83f109e85
'}, {'created': '2018-09-25 12:32:30.000000000', 'message': 'add local tox targets for pep8 and py3

This patch adds local tox targets for pep8 and python 3 as per [1]
that will install dependencies in editable mode.
To run them use the pep8-dev and py3-dev targets respectively.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-sibling-setup

Change-Id: I29638781271436a425d3ba8bd0f941b83f109e85
'}, {'created': '2018-09-26 14:31:19.000000000', 'message': 'add local tox targets for pep8 and py3

This patch adds local tox targets for pep8 and python 3 as per [1]
that will install dependencies in editable mode.
To run them use the pep8-dev and py3-dev targets respectively.

In addition this patch:
- Adds bandit to pep8 which is used by most projects today.
- Disables a handful of pylint errors in the code; these can be
addressed by devs as time permits.
- Sets the python env to python 3.5 for pep8 targets.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-sibling-setup

Change-Id: I29638781271436a425d3ba8bd0f941b83f109e85
'}, {'created': '2018-12-13 22:03:26.000000000', 'message': 'update project for zuul v3

This patch adds a few things to get the project up to speed for zuul v3:
- Adds the pep8-dev and py3-dev tox targets for local testing [1].
- Switches the zuul config to use the neutron version of the lower
constraints job ensure neutron from source is used.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-sibling-setup

Change-Id: I29638781271436a425d3ba8bd0f941b83f109e85
'}]
commit_message:
update project for zuul v3

This patch adds a few things to get the project up to speed for zuul v3:
- Adds the pep8-dev and py3-dev tox targets for local testing [1].
- Switches the zuul config to use the neutron version of the lower
constraints job ensure neutron from source is used.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-sibling-setup

Change-Id: I29638781271436a425d3ba8bd0f941b83f109e85

(6 comments)

i am generally in favor of this.

some nits inline.

i think the set of thing you will be able to validate beyond simply comparing checking if they are set in both the image and flavor will be limited.

almost all the example given in the spec i would consider to be virt dirver specific in one way or another but very basic validate should be posible. we need to be careful to not include and libvirt semantics in the validation in the validation of thinks like realtime mask which is only supported by libvirt or the numa constraints most of which are only supported by libvirt.'}, {'account_id': 28433, 'date': '2019-01-04 17:06:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Flavor Extra Spec and Image Properties Validation

Validate the combination of the flavor extra-specs and image properties.
If validation failed then synchronously return error to user.

blueprint: flavor-extra-spec-image-property-validation
Change-Id: Ic1c5b28f6f58c07744eb193faef1b52c7ecfe693
Signed-off-by: Jack Ding <jack.ding@windriver.com>

use neutron-lib for model_query

This patch switches to code over to use neutron-lib's model_query
module rather than neutrons.

Change-Id: I4a8cc6cd8226fe843495b0bbaf2d5204457f9646

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-09 11:01:38.000000000', 'message': 'Ironic dnsmasq should not use VIP for TFTP server

The ironic_dnsmasq config for ironic inspector uses the internal VIP for
the TFTP server address DHCP option. This is not going to work,
since HAProxy is not configured to forward TFTP, and does not support
UDP forwarding anyway. The config should use the api_interface IP for
the host running ironic_dnsmasq.

Change-Id: I56a0d46e9b528041cacea7196a525891ed5922f0
Closes-Bug: #1761815
'}, {'created': '2018-04-10 18:25:27.000000000', 'message': 'Ironic dnsmasq should not use VIP for TFTP server

The ironic_dnsmasq config for ironic inspector uses the internal VIP for
the TFTP server address DHCP option. This is not going to work,
since HAProxy is not configured to forward TFTP, and does not support
UDP forwarding anyway. The config should use the api_interface IP for
the host running ironic_dnsmasq.

Change-Id: I56a0d46e9b528041cacea7196a525891ed5922f0
Closes-Bug: #1761815

commit_message:
Ironic dnsmasq should not use VIP for TFTP server

The ironic_dnsmasq config for ironic inspector uses the internal VIP for
the TFTP server address DHCP option. This is not going to work,
since HAProxy is not configured to forward TFTP, and does not support
UDP forwarding anyway. The config should use the api_interface IP for
the host running ironic_dnsmasq.

Change-Id: I56a0d46e9b528041cacea7196a525891ed5922f0
Closes-Bug: #1761815

commit_message:
Correct the test for proxy.http

proxy.http | trim returns "None" instead of "". To test if proxy should
be used, when: proxy.http should be good enough.
We don't have to test if proxy.http is defined or not. Because it is
alredy defined in defaults/main.yaml.

Change-Id: Ia6330907d22c3f46586aec16db3eefab1a5bbac9
Task: 28755
Story: 2004717

commit_message:
Pin setuptools and wheels packages

In order to maintain consistency for pip versions, align pip, wheels,
and setuptools. Use OSA as a basis for consistency between deploy
projects.

Depends-On: I573bd84e1f15b6e9bda8ebb1d8e12fa66970757a
Change-Id: I123508ad8c65805f6d95abe5e592e7e761d63142

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: I4c57fcab159403bd167db49b697c23c8a2865d8e
Related-Bug: 1801465

commit_message:
Wait for port to change state to ACTIVE

It is possible that the port is in a DOWN or a BUILD state when
the ports are polled.  This allows the port(s) some time
(CONF.build_timeout) to transition state and then we adjust the
status accordingly.

Change-Id: Ie9e284b58a0bc05b3d795b0465f1a91314d400a9

[{'created': '2019-01-08 11:03:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for RADOS gateway per unit cephx keys

If ceph-radosgw units present a key_name attribute, then generate
a cephx key using the key name and present back with the key_name
as the prefix for the key.

This switches radosgw units to having per-unit keys, rather than
sharing a global key (required as part of the pre-work to support
RADOS gateway federation).

commit_message:
Add support for RADOS gateway per unit cephx keys

If ceph-radosgw units present a key_name attribute, then generate
a cephx key using the key name and present back with the key_name
as the prefix for the key.

This switches radosgw units to having per-unit keys, rather than
sharing a global key (required as part of the pre-work to support
RADOS gateway federation).

Change-Id: I289b75a2935184817b424c5eceead16235c3f53b
Depends-On: I7ac4d23a91fa654b62afb62c389a8f9823ef2e05
Closes-Bug: 1808140
